original.title: Original — TEF CANADA Expression Orale (Full source)

README.title: TEF Oral Docs
README.description: This folder contains the imported TEF materials.

section_A/questions_grammar_by_category.title: TEF Canada — Grammar Patterns for Section A Questions
section_A/questions_grammar_by_category.description: This document lists the main grammar structures used in the questions from topicsquestionsby_category.md. For each category I summarize the recurring grammar points, give short explanations and present example question templates you can reuse during practice.

section_A/section_a_playbook.title: TEF Canada: Section A Playbook
section_A/section_a_playbook.description: This document provides a strategic guide for successfully completing Section A of the TEF Canada Expression Orale exam. It contains a framework for structuring your conversation, key techniques to improve your performance, and a bank of ready-to-use questions for common topics.

section_A/section_a_playbook1.title: Section A Playbook — TEF Canada (Practical Guide)

section_A/standard_questions_quick_refer.title: TEF Canada — Standard Questions Quick Reference
section_A/standard_questions_quick_refer.description: This is a quick-reference markdown file listing the standard questions from each topic in the TEF-CANADA-Expression-Oral.md. Use this during practice to prepare for Section A simulations.

section_A/topics.title: Section A — Topics
section_A/topics.description: This file lists all topics found under Section A (Topics) in TEF-CANADA-Expression-Oral.md.

section_A/topics_by_category.title: TEF Canada — Section A Topics (by category)
section_A/topics_by_category.description: This document groups the Section A topics from TEF-CANADA-Expression-Oral.md into practical categories for study and practice.

section_A/topics_questions_by_category.title: TEF Canada — Section A: Questions by Category
section_A/topics_questions_by_category.description: This file groups practical questions for Section A topics by category. For each category you will find:

section_A/verbs_conjugations.title: TEF Canada — Verbs and Conjugations (key tenses)
section_A/verbs_conjugations.description: This file lists common verbs used in the TEF Section A materials and gives conjugation tables for these tenses:

section_A/vocab_by_category.title: TEF Canada — Essential Vocabulary by Category
section_A/vocab_by_category.description: This list collects essential French vocabulary used in Section A questions (and related topics) with English translations. Use it for study, flashcards, or quick reference during practice.

section_B/grammar_section_B.title: Section B — Essential Grammar Structures
section_B/grammar_section_B.description: This file covers the most important grammar structures used in Section B discussions. Master these patterns to speak naturally, persuasively, and grammatically correct.

section_B/section_b_playbook.title: Section B Playbook — Complete Strategic Guide

section_B/topic.title: Section B — Complete Topic List
section_B/topic.description: This file contains all Section B topics extracted from TEF-CANADA-Expression-Oral.md. Each topic is structured as a presentation followed by suggested counter-arguments and objections students might encounter.

section_B/verbs_conjugations.title: Section B — Essential Verbs & Conjugations
section_B/verbs_conjugations.description: This reference contains the most important verbs for Section B discussions, conjugated across all necessary tenses for expressing arguments, objections, preferences, and persuasion.

section_B/Vocabs.title: Section B — Essential Vocabulary & Translations
section_B/Vocabs.description: This file contains key vocabulary from all Section B topics, organized by category. Use this reference to understand topic concepts and build arguments during your 10-minute discussions.

tef-exam.title: TEF Exam Overview
tef-exam.description: This guide helps you prepare for the TEF Canada Expression Orale exam with focused practice materials, vocabulary, and grammar references. Start here to understand the structure and jump into the sections you need most.
